summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) memorandum documenting the receipt of emails from the Facility Manager of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding the prison's camera system. The emails were provided in relation to the OIG's investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC. The document references a prior interview with the Facility Manager and attaches several emails about camera system installation timelines.

keyFacts: This document is part of the OIG's investigation into the circumstances surrounding the death of Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.
The Facility Manager of the MCC New York was interviewed on August 4, 2021, and subsequently provided emails about the prison's camera system.
The emails detail timelines related to the arrival, installation, and project management of a new camera system at the MCC, with key dates in 2018 and 2019.
The document explicitly states it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the OIG and is for limited official use only.
